intro: Scutellaria nummularia, commonly known as lesser mouse-ear or scutellaria, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. Its small, two-lipped flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Scutellaria nummularia is often found in grassy areas, woodland edges, and along pathways, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
